derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (as a noun): probably of Germanic origin; ultimately imitative

entry.def: If someone blabs about something secret, they tell people about it.

example.ex: Her mistake was to blab about their affair...
example.tran: 她错在说出了他们的婚外情。

means.word_mean: 2. speak (about unimportant matters) rapidly and incessantly

auth_sentence.content: "Because Bible says blab, blab, blab " So what?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Because Bible says blab, blab, blab " So what?

auth_sentence.content: How many people would I want to blab to bout your drinkin and foolishness?

auth_sentence.content: Don't blab about the Botox I cringed on reading speculation this weekend that Louise Mensch has had a facelift.

sentences.en: She will be sure to blab and it will be all over the town in no time.

sentences.en: Who will open himself to a blab?
